contextId.information: Both "The time" and "the day" refer to the time when God will punish the people of Israel. AT: "Israel's punishment will happen very soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: The time is coming; the day has come close

contextId.information: These phrases are both ways God is telling the people of Israel that the things he has warned about, will happen soon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: My words will not be delayed any longer, but the word that I have spoken will be done

contextId.information: Barley is a grain used to make bread and the word "crumb" is a small amount of bread. Both phrases are small amounts of food and are used to emphasize how small the payment was to the prophetesses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: handfuls of barley and crumbs of bread

contextId.information: Both of these phrases refer to talking about what will happen in the future. AT: "continue to make false predictions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: have false visions or continue to make predictions

contextId.information: Yahweh asks Ezekiel the same question twice in order to secure Ezekiel's commitment to pronounce the judgement. AT: "Are you ready to pronounce judgment on them, son of man?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Will you judge them? Will you judge, son of man?

contextId.information: Both of these phrases refer to the place where the two roads meet. AT: "at the crossroads" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: at the crossroads, at the junction

contextId.information: Both of these phrases are idioms that mean that the time when Yahweh will punish Jerusalem is very near. AT: "Because of these things you have done, you are approaching the end of your time" or "You are bringing your time to an end" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: For you have drawn your days close and approached your final years.

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. AT: "So I will cause them to separate from each other and live in different nations"(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: So I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you through the lands

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize the violence that the princes practice. AT: "They murder people" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: They pour out blood and destroy life

contextId.information: This phrase means basically the same thing as the previous phrase and emphasizes the immoral behavior of the two young women. This can be stated in active form. AT: "there men fondled their virgin nipples." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: their virgin nipples were fondled there

contextId.information: The phrases "plunder your riches" and "loot your merchandise" mean about the same thing and are repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: They will plunder your riches and loot your merchandise

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. See how you translated similar phrases in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: scatter Egypt among the nations and disperse them among the lands

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. See how you translated similar phrases in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: scatter Egypt among the nations and disperse them through the lands

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. AT: "I caused them to separate and live in separate lands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: I scattered them among the nations; they were dispersed through the lands
